Taking some hard breaths, Tucson lowers his arm, and allows Straight Shot t=
o transform and stand beside him.  She sighs in relief.  She looks up to hi=
m.

" That was way too close that time Tucson.  Rodimus is right, what was =
that all about?"

Tucson turns his attentions to Rodimus and Straight Shot.=


" I - I don't know.  I'm sorry.  Of course, no harm will come to anyone h=
ere, Legacy, Rodimus, excuse my actions, they were not done with the best o=
f judgement."

Straight Shot looks to Tucson, and this time with a concerne=
d look on her face.

" Ever since that day, you haven't been the same.  I k=
now, I was there, and lemme tell ya it haunts me too.  Have ya ever thought=
 ta open up about it Tucson?  Maybe that would kinda help ya heal a little =
bit.  The wounds are still fresh, even though that fight was a long time ag=
o."

Tucson nodds.

" You're right.  Rodimus, Legacy, I've been keeping som=
ething from you for a long time, and that's not what a respectable leader d=
oes.  A leader may be strong but he too, must open up about the issues that=
 weaken his state of mind.  It all started on the day of that battle, that =
had Rodimus abducted and taken over by Hydras and his forces.  I fought in =
that battle as a soldier. And being a Ninjabot myself, I knew of Nightrazor=
's properties, yet I felt that if I barged in on Rodimus, it would only lan=
d me with a case of insubordination.  So, I refrained from doing so, but tr=
ied to divert enemy attentions indirectly.  For the most part it worked and=
 I was able to fight my way through those who knew nothing about Ninjabot c=
ombat.  Yet, there were seekers who were far more swift on their wings then=
 I was on my wheels.  They were bearing down on the Autobots, to the point =
that I felt that if I did not step in, there wouldn't be an Autobot left to=
 defend the Ark or the planet."

He pauses.

" From what I remember, I tran=
sformed into my vehicle mode, and started to kick up dirt from my tires, in=
 hopes that a seeker would see what I was up to.  It worked, and I grabbed =
the attention of several, although I couldn't see who they were because the=
y were rather high up from me.  Then, suddenly, I was struck.  And I don't =
remember anything more than that.  A long time afterwards, I was brought ba=
ck online, and when I woke up, I could only see darkness.  At first, I thou=
ght it was a power outage, but then, I was told that my optic sensors were =
completely destroyed by the cranial shot that I had endured during that cha=
se.  I asked about you Rodimus, but, no one could tell me what happened.  I=
t was at that point where I knew that I failed you  If only I had listened =
to myself the first time, and came in front of you when you were chasing Ni=
ghtrazor that first time.  You would not have suffered as you had, nor woul=
d your family. And since then, I pledged to get back on my feet, and never =
let my defenses down again, and if I had to, I'd strike back harder than an=
y Decepticon or Predacon could ever fathom.  I failed you once Rodimus, and=
 I pledged NEVER to let that happen again."

Straight Shot looks to Tucson =
with a thoughtful gaze.

"Wow, you never even told me all that before.  Wel=
l, since we're opening up about it, I wish I could help you guys understand=
 what happened, but I only remember a little bit more than he does. Right b=
efore he got shot, I saw Cyclonus decending just a tad closser to us than t=
he other seekers that were following us.  I saw him take the shot and I scr=
eamed, and that's when everything went blank.  I think what would really he=
lp Tucson now, is knowing that what happened, really wasn't his fault."

Tu=
cson now turns his head toward Megatron's body.

" Having the Decepticons h=
ere amongst us is highly un nerving to me.  There must be a way to separate=
 them from the Autobots, and place them in a safe location...  Wait, I reme=
mber something..  The Decepticons had their own craft, The Nemisis...  Why =
couldn't we return them to their rightful craft and separate them from the =
Autobots, where both factions would be safe from harm?  Rodimus, due to cir=
cumbstances which I have just told you, for my own emotional stability, I c=
an not have these Decepticons here.  But I'm willing to help preserve them =
in a safe location away from the Ark.  Legacy, if you could, I'd like you t=
o find out where the Nemisis is now located and if it is within reach.  Onc=
e located, I want the Decepticons brought safely back to their own ship, wh=
ere they can rest in peace, thus leaving the Ark to the Autobots to do the =
same."

Straight Shot smiles.

"Now that's more like the Tucson I know.  I =
like that idea, I like it alot."

Outside the Ark, Uproar and Quickstride l=
ook to each other and just shrug off the event.

"Hmm, oh well, would've be=
en fun ta see them end up in the tar pit but, works for me, Uproar."

Uproa=
r nodds.

"Ditto.  Okay, so, I guess we can go back inside."

They get into=
 beast mode, and prance back into the Ark. Yet, Uproar could not help but l=
ook back with a perplexed look on his face.
